tabData.tagHTML: Ajiva means anything that is non-living. It doesn't have a soul (Jiva), so it can't feel happy or sad, and it doesn't have birth or death. Because it's inert (Achetan), it cannot accumulate any karma. Think of your toys, books, or a rock ‚Äì they are all Ajiva!
These substances make up the universe along with Jiva (living beings). Let's explore the five types of Ajiva together!

tabData.title: The 5 Types of Ajiva
tabData.description: Click on a card to flip and learn more about each Ajiva substance.

cards.back: Medium of Motion - Helps souls and matter to move.
Medium of Rest - Helps souls and matter to rest.
Space - Provides room for all other substances.
Matter - Everything physical: sight, sound, taste, touch, smell.
Time - Measures changes in the universe.

data.tagHTML: This is what allows Jivas and Pudgal (matter) to move! It is made of two words: Dharma (medium of motion) + Astik√§y (collection of spaces).

items.content:
• It does not make things move, but it helps them move.
  • It exists in the entire cosmic universe (Lok√§k√§sh).
  • It is absent in the trans-cosmic space (Alok√§k√§sh).
Without water, a fish can't swim. Without Dharm√§stik√§y, we couldn't move!

data.tagHTML: This substance helps moving things to stop and rest. It is made of two words: Adharma (medium of rest) + Astik√§y (collection of spaces).

items.content:
• It does not force things to rest, but it helps them rest.
  • Like Dharm√§stik√§y, it exists in the Lok√§k√§sh but is absent in the Alok√§k√§sh.

items.header: Analogy: The Traveler and the Tree üå≥
items.content: A tired traveler rests under the shade of a tree. The shade doesn't make them rest, but it helps them rest. Adharm√§stik√§y is like that tree's shade for the universe!

data.tagHTML: This is the space that gives room to all the other substances. It's everywhere! It is divided into two parts:

items.content:
The part of space where all the other 5 substances exist. It contains:

  • Siddhashila - Abode of liberated beings (at the top)
  • Devloka - Abode of celestial beings
  • Middle World - Abode of Humans & Animals
  • Naraka - Abode of Hellish beings (7 levels)
The infinite, empty space beyond the Lok√§k√§sh. No souls, matter, or other substances exist here.

data.tagHTML: Pudgal is everything you can see, touch, taste, or smell! It's the only substance with a physical body. Sound, light, and even darkness are types of matter.

The word Pudgal comes from two words: Pud (combine) and Gal (dissociate). Matter can combine to form larger objects (Skandha) and break apart into the smallest indivisible particle (Param√§nu or Anu).

data.title: 8 Vargan√§s (Special Matter)
data.description: The soul interacts with these 8 special types of matter.

cards.back: Makes a physical body for humans and animals.
Makes a special body for heavenly and infernal beings.
Makes a special body for advanced monks to travel long distances.
Responsible for heat and digestion power.
Responsible for speech.
Responsible for the physical mind.
Responsible for breathing.
Makes the Karmic body (our karma!).

data.tagHTML: Time measures changes. It's like a giant wheel (K√§lchakra) that's always turning. Each full rotation of the K√§lchakra consists of two half-cycles.

items.content:
The current half-cycle where conditions worsen over time. It has 6 √Ñr√§s (spokes):

  1. Sukham Sukham (Happy-Happy) - 4 KKS*
  2. Sukham (Happy) - 3 KKS*
  3. Sukham Dukham (Happy-Sad) - 2 KKS*
  4. Dukham Sukham (Sad-Happy) - 1 KKS*
  5. Dukham (Sad) - 21,000 Years (Current √Ñr√§)
  6. Dukham Dukham (Sad-Sad) - 21,000 Years

*KKS = Kod√§ Kodi S√§garopam

The half-cycle where conditions improve over time. Order is reversed from Avasarpini.

  1. Dukham Dukham (Sad-Sad) - 21,000 Years
  2. Dukham (Sad) - 21,000 Years
  3. Dukham Sukham (Sad-Happy) - 1 KKS*
  4. Sukham Dukham (Happy-Sad) - 2 KKS*
  5. Sukham (Happy) - 3 KKS*
  6. Sukham Sukham (Happy-Happy) - 4 KKS*
